articles.title: Actions for Removal of MacArthur's Statue Going on in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Removal of MacArthur's Statue Going on in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Joint Measure Committee of Struggle for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces from south Korea held a meeting at the square in front of the building of the Inchon City Office on June 3 strongly demanding the removal of the statue of MacArthur, the chieftain of the Korean war of aggression, according to the south Korean MBC.
 The organization expressed resentment at the authorities for having kept his statue in Freedom Park in Inchon for decades, deploring that such a thing cannot be found in any other place in the world.    
 At the end of the meeting, the organization handed an open letter demanding the removal of the statue to the mayor of Inchon before entering into a sit-in strike inside tents in front of the building.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Secretary General of IMO
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Secretary General of IMO
    Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with Efthimios E. Mitropoulos, secretary general of the International Maritime Organization
(IMO), at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 Present there were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and Deputy Director of the State Bureau of Maritime Supervision Jon Ki Chol.

articles.title: DPRK Government Economic Delegation Leaves for African Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Government Economic Delegation Leaves for African Countries
    Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government economic delegation led by Minister of Foreign Trade Rim Kyong Man left here Monday to visit Uganda, Kenya, Guinea and Mali.
 The delegation will drop in Yemen, too.

Greetings to Ethiopian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Ethiopian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Seyoum Mesfin, foreign minister of Ethiopia,
on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Ethiopia.
 Expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue to boost, the message wished the Ethiopian people greater success in their efforts to defend national dignity and achieve progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Swedish King
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Swedish King
    Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Carl Gustaf, king of Sweden, Monday on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative ties would continue to grow stronger in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to Italian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Italian President
    Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Italian President Carlo Azeglio Ciampi on June 2 on the occasion of the national day of Italy.
 Expressing the belief that the bilateral relations would further expand and develop in the future, the message wished the Italian people fresh progress and prosperity.
